docs.snippet: Millions now have fitness-tracking devices. But are they any use?...
docs.lead_paragraph: Millions now have fitness-tracking devices. But are they any use?
docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by author Alex Hutchinson examines question of whether wearable fitness tracking devices are of any real long term benefit to individuals using them; notes many companies believe wearable computing's future lies in harnessing data logged by such devices to help researchers determine what makes people healthier and fitter.

headline.main: How a Fitbit May Make You a Bit Fit

docs.snippet: What happened when Gabi Asfour, of the high-concept label threeASFOUR, set out to design uniforms for the Baltimore Symphony Orchestra....

docs.abstract: Baltimore Symphony Orchestra music director Marin Alsop explores having fashion for musicians updated to allow them more comfort and flexibility to play; collaborates with teachers and students at Parsons School of Design on new dress code that builds on tradition.

headline.main: Orchestras Get in Tune With Modern Black-Tie
headline.print_headline: High Notes of a Different Order
